Option J: BB × BB. Both are homozygous dominant, so all offspring are BB, which is 100% black. Doesn't fit.

So Option B probably isn't correct unless there's more information.

Option C: bb × Bb. Both parents are homozygous recessive (bb) and heterozygous (Bb). Cross would be bb × Bb. The possible gametes from bb are all b, and from Bb are B and b.
